sourceString: The practice of serving yourself from a common plate with your own chopsticks, common in China, should be avoided.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan ya cam në than tök ago raan dɛ̈t ce xok.

sourceString: Greet people without touching them.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan kɔc ya muɔth ke cï kɔc dɔm cin.

sourceString: Avoid hugs, kisses, handshakes, fist bumps, and any other contact.
targetString: Duɔnë raan dɔm cin ku duɔnë raan päätic.

sourceString: If it's impossible to avoid contact, then wash your hands both before and after.
targetString: Na rilic acan ba kɔc ce päl në thiec ke yïn ye yecin waak apiɛth tecin raan muɔth.

sourceString: It won't protect you from the coronavirus, but it will partially protect you from the flu, which remains a greater risk than COVID-19 in many areas.
targetString: Acï lɛ̈u bï tiɛt guöp wei coronavirus, alɛ̈u bï tiɛt guöp wei juäi, ku e yen la guöp riɔ̈c ka wär COVID-19 ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n juëc iic.

sourceString: This also saves you from unnecessary worry if you get the flu and think it might be the coronavirus.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan yecin ya waak ago ce ye diɛr mɛn bï tuaany yïn dɔm.

sourceString: If you are elderly or otherwise in a high-risk group and can be vaccinated for pneumonia, get that vaccination.
targetString: Na ye raan cï duɔp ke ka kɔɔr ba rɔt tit apiɛth në ye tuanyë.

sourceString: It won't protect you from viral pneumonia from COVID-19, but some COVID-19 patients have died of bacterial pneumonia that attacked their weakened lungs, so a pneumonia vaccination could save your life.
targetString: Acï raan ë COVID-19 gël në tuany de guyɔɔk. Ë raan kony amääth bï raan cï tuany në COVID-19.

sourceString: Wearing masks is recommended for those who are suspected of carrying of disease and those who are in close contact with those infected.
targetString: Cɛ̈ŋcɛ̈ŋ alɛ̈th ye kɔc ke wum ku thook kum aacï kek gam tën kɔc ye kɔc puöth diu ciɛ̈t ke ɣɛ̈c tuany ku kɔc lac thiäk kek kɔc cï luaŋ.

sourceString: For those who are asymptomatic, the WHO does not recommend masks, though some national governments do.
targetString: A kënë akutnhom de gël de tuany luel mɛn ye cɔl WHO,wu bï raan kën tuany yewum ya duut.

sourceString: Wearing a mask of some kind is required in some countries and cities in an effort to reduce community transmission.
targetString: Aaye bɛ̈i ku pɛn kɔ̈k luel wu raan ëbɛ̈n aduut yewum në kany agorë ɣok de tuany në wuötic dhuɔ̈k nyin piny.

sourceString: There are worldwide shortages of surgical masks.
targetString: Käk ye kɔc ke wuum duut kë acïn thök në dolat kɔ̈k yïc.

sourceString: If you do wear a mask, make sure to use it correctly.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan yewum ya duut apiɛth.

sourceString: The mask should cover your nose and mouth and fit without gaps.
targetString: Alath de Duɔt ë wum akɔɔr bï wum ku thok ya kum apiɛth.

sourceString: Wash your hands before putting on the mask and avoid touching the mask while wearing it.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan yecin kɔn waak ku jɔ yewum ben kum.

sourceString: If you do touch it, wash your hands immediately afterwards.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan yecin ya waak në nyindhie ku jɔl alath de Duɔt ë wum ben jak.

sourceString: When the mask becomes damp, discard and replace it.
targetString: Na cï cuɔl alath de Duɔt ë wum ke cuatëwei ku tau ë dɛ̈t.

sourceString: Remove it from the back, throw it away, and then wash your hands.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan alath de Duɔt ë wum nyaai ku wɛɛk yecin.

sourceString: Remember that masks are not a substitute for good hygiene: continue to wash your hands frequently.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan nyic mɛn yen alath de Duɔt ë wum acï tuaany ë gël arëëtic.

sourceString: Don't stock up on masks if you don't need them.
targetString: Duɔnë kë ca juëc baai te cïn kë bï ceŋ

sourceString: Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.
targetString: Lïu alɛ̈th ye kɔc ke wum ku thook kum aye nyuɔth lɔn ka ril ic bï akïm alɛ̈th ye kɔc ke thook kum muk apath, ku e raan ebën cɔl ariɔ̈c tuany.

sourceString: That includes N95 respirators, which are not recommended for the general public – these are specialist equipment which must be fitted to be optimally effective.
targetString: Anɔŋic kede wëi ye cɔl N95, ku ka cï piɛth kenë akuyhnom-  aye ka  cïke loi apiɛth bïkë loi kɔɔr ya loi.

sourceString: Leave them for healthcare workers.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï alath ke duɔt ë wum ya tɔ̈u kenë dïktor.

sourceString: Avoid crowded areas, especially enclosed areas without much air circulation, such as conferences, performances, shopping malls, public transportation, and religious services.
targetString: Duɔnë ye lɔ të nɔŋ kɔc juëc arëëtic, cï mɛn de amɛɛt, dhuuk, caath në riɛth dït kë, ku jal ya ɣan ke kanitha.

sourceString: Events which involve a large scale gathering of people, from religious pilgrimages to music concerts, are being canceled worldwide, in an effort to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Xan yenë kɔc juëc ke giɛr cï mɛn de kanitha ku të da apala acï ke thök thok ebën në akuma.

sourceString: Tourist attractions, businesses, and transportation may be closed, especially in affected countries.
targetString: Caath de riɛth ku kɔc wën ë piny cath acï ke thök thok ebën.

sourceString: Some canceled events, especially performances, sporting events, and classes, are being moved online, which means you can experience them without traveling.
targetString: Käk yeke looi cï kek tem kɔ̈th, cïmen kɛ̈tkɛ̈t, käk riäŋ, ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n piööc, aacï nyai bi kek ɣäth webthaid kɔ̈u, ku wɛ̈tde ic alɛ̈u ba kek yɔ̈k ke yï cï la keny.

sourceString: At petrol/gas stations, use gloves or wipe down the handle with a disinfectant wipe if you can.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan yecin ya muɔc në boloma te kiir xen jath.

sourceString: After filling up, clean your hands with hand sanitizer.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan yecin ya waak te cen thök në kiir de jaath.

sourceString: The U.S. and Canadian governments recommend avoiding travel by cruise ship.
targetString: Akuma de U.S. ku Canada acï kɔc kën yök bïke caath në wɛ̈ric pɔɔl.

sourceString: Infections spread easily on board, and medical care is limited.
targetString: Tuanyë ë rɔt dac wɔɔk arëëtic.

sourceString: Amid a cruise ship outbreak, quarantines and docking are challenging partly due to the large number of people aboard.
targetString: Caath në wɛ̈ric acï yic riɛl acan kɔc juëc akɔr bïke lɔ në bɛɛi kën.

sourceString: Even cruise ships without confirmed cases have been denied permission to dock due to virus fears, and in the high-profile case of the Diamond Princess in Japan, hundreds of people were infected on the ship.
targetString: Agut cï babuur cïn yic raan cï tuany acike bɛr ca määc wath thok në wën de riɔc de tuany, ku në pan ye cɔl Diamond Princess në Japan, kɔc juëc areetic aka tuany në bauuric.

sourceString: If you believe you may be infected, call a hospital or local emergency medical services instead of going in person to avoid infecting others.
targetString: Na ye rɔt dïïu cït ke yic tuany ke yï cɔl kɔc ke pan akim bike yï lɔ them guɔp.

sourceString: Mention your symptoms and travel history.
targetString: Na ca lɔ pan akim ke yï luel te ye luɔ̈i yïn

sourceString: Wear a medical mask and follow the instructions of authorities and doctors.
targetString: Cɛŋ alanh ye kɔc ke wum ku thook kum ku buɔth lööŋ ye akuma ku akïm lɛ̈k yïn.

sourceString: See also: Flight and health
targetString: Akɔɔr ba pial de guɔp ku caath tïŋ apieth.

sourceString: On a plane, follow the same hygiene practices as anywhere else: wash hands frequently, or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer if it's not convenient to leave your seat, and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Tiyara ic, buɔth dhɔ̈ɔ̈l ye kɔc rɔ̈t tit cïmen tëdɛ̈t: ye yï cin lɔɔk kuat dhaman thok ebën, wula luɔ̈i miök ye käm nök kɔc cin të cï yen rot lɛ̈u ba tedun nyuc nyaŋ thïn, ku duk yï nyin e gɔt.

sourceString: Researchers have found that passengers in window seats have less risk of contact with sick people.
targetString: Aluel kɔc kɔ̈k wu raan rëër te thiɔ̈k kenë awër de thayara acï në bï tuaany dac yök.

sourceString: Try to book a window seat, and avoid moving around the cabin during the flight.
targetString: Them ba tën nyuc thiäk kek aluït ye dɔm, ku duk cath tiyara ic të cɛth yen.

sourceString: After washing your hands and before sitting down, use disinfectant wipes to wipe down the area around your seat.
targetString: Të cï yïn yï cin lɔɔk ku të këc yïn guɔ nyuc piiny, luɔ̈i kä ye kɔc ke wuny bï yïn të rɛ̈ɛ̈r kurthïdu thïn wuny.

sourceString: Wipe hard surfaces, and if your seat is leather you can wipe that too.
targetString: Wec xan yekë dac jak në kɔc cin.

sourceString: Don't wipe a cloth seat, as the moisture can make transmission easier.
targetString: Duɔnë alath de rëër wec acan tuanyë ë rɔt wɔɔk arëëtic të nɔŋ piu

sourceString: When using disinfectant wipes, follow the instructions on the packaging.
targetString: Akɔɔr ba yï cin wec apiɛth cï të kör ë yen.

sourceString: And remember, viruses enter through your mouth, nose, and eyes – wiping down the area doesn't hurt, but it's not a substitute for proper hygiene.
targetString: Ku akɔɔr ba nyic mɛn ë tuanyë ë tëk në raan thok ku raan wum ku jɔl ya raan nyin.

sourceString: Wash your hands and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan yecin ya waak ku cï ye nyin ye jak në cin nɔŋ acuɔl.

sourceString: And use a tissue to touch the touch screen or other controls.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan alath thinë löm ke wec yen yecin.

sourceString: When using the lavatory, use paper towels to turn off the faucet and open the door, then throw them away.
targetString: Na lɔk yïcin në makana ye cɔl lavatory ke yïn wec yicin në alath

sourceString: Airlines in affected areas are taking steps to reduce transmission and keep passengers safe.
targetString: Kɔc ë käät në thayara akɔɔr bïkë rɔth ya gël ë ya.

sourceString: For instance, these may include cleaning facilities more frequently, allowing flight attendants to wear masks, and serving prepackaged instead of freshly heated meals.
targetString: Ku keya, kën alɛ̈u bï ic naŋ aguiɛr ye käk ye kɔc lui lac aguir, ku bï kɔc lui tiyara ya puöl bïk cɛŋ alɛ̈th ye kɔc ke wum ku thook kum, ku yekä kɔc yiɛ̈k mïïth cï kek bɔk tën mïïth puɔc tuöc.

sourceString: If a group of passengers is connecting from an area with a severe outbreak, the flight attendants may be able to seat them away from the rest of the passengers (and if you were recently in a high-risk area, consider telling the flight attendants for this reason).
targetString: Të le akut kɔc cath tiyara pan wën la ic tuany, ka kɔc lui tiyara ic alɛ̈u bï kek cɔl anyuc të mec ke kɔc kök cath riäu (ku na yï rɛ̈ɛ̈r të la ic tuany, ka yï lɛ̈k raan lui riäi ic rin kën).

sourceString: You may be prohibited from changing seats on the flight.
targetString: Acï kɔɔr bï raan thɔ̈ɔ̈ny cen nyuc xan ke nyuc te dɛ̈t peei.

sourceString: This is so that, if someone on the flight turns out to be infected, the authorities can track down the people who were sitting near them for testing or quarantine.
targetString: Aye loi wuya acan na yök raan ke tuany ke bï yic bï raan kɔr ku dac yök, kɔc cï rëër eke thiɔ̈k në kek abï ke them guɔp eya.

sourceString: COVID-19 is treated by relieving symptoms and preventing complications.
targetString: COVID-19 ayenë raan yën wal bï tɔ̈ɔ̈k dhuɔ̈k piny ku bï raan cen ke loi rɔt yen.

sourceString: There is no vaccine or specific treatment for the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Acïn wɛ̈l dɛ̈t cï go loi ëmɛn ë

sourceString: Research into a vaccine or specific antiviral drug is underway.
targetString: Wɛ̈l de ye tuanyë aŋot ke loi.

sourceString: There are a variety of trials using HIV medications and other novel antiviral medications for treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Acï them bï tök në wɛl ke HIV ku ka kën rɔt lëu ye tuany ye cɔl COVID-19

sourceString: Mild symptoms may be relieved by taking paracetamol (acetaminophen).
targetString: Atuɔi de ye tuanyë aye tök në paracetamol

sourceString: If you are infected with COVID-19, countries will isolate you until several consecutive tests for COVID-19 are negative.
targetString: Na cï yök ke yï tuany në COVID-19, ke yïn ye ca rɛ̈ɛ̈r të tök ago kɔc ce ɣook.

sourceString: If you have been in close contact with someone infected with COVID-19, many countries will quarantine you for 14 days since the last exposure and monitor you for signs and symptoms.
targetString: Na ca rëër wenë raan cï tuany në COVID-19 ke yïn ye ca rɛ̈ɛ̈r në nïn ke 14  acan bï kan ɣoi.

sourceString: Some countries will also test you even if you don't have symptoms.
targetString: Dolat kɔ̈k aye raan kɔn them ku bï tïŋ mɛn cï raan tuany ë ya.

sourceString: In many countries, the healthcare system has been stretched to the point of not being able to handle the sheer number of patients, and there is a chance you may be refused treatment due to the lack of available medical staff, supplies or equipment.
targetString: Dolat kɔ̈k acï kɔc cï tuany ke juëc aka cïke ye lëu në them, alë bï yïn rɛɛc në töök acan cïn dïktoor juëc tau ku jal ya kak yenë panakïm ke lui.

sourceString: Many countries have shut down or severely limited flights, ships, and border crossings, especially to and from affected areas.
targetString: Gɛth juëc aacï bɛ̈ɛ̈i thiök piny wula aacï cäth tiyara cɔl akor ic, riɛ̈th wïïr, ku tɛ̈m akɛth kɔ̈ɔ̈th, la ku bɛ̈n ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n wën cï luaŋ.

sourceString: Even more countries have imposed restrictions on arriving travelers, either barring entry (maybe with an exception for local citizens and permanent residents) or requiring you to be quarantined, typically for 14 days.
targetString: Bɛ̈ɛ̈i kɔ̈k acï lɔ̈ŋ kën täu në riɛl. Raan cï bɛ̈n ëbɛ̈n aye kan täu tëde yitok ku bï kan ɣoi në nïnic ke 14.

sourceString: Even if a mandatory quarantine is not imposed, you may be asked to "self-quarantine" by staying at home and not interacting with other people.
targetString: Cɔk alɔn kïc lɛ̈lɛ̈l thok looi ke ril ic, ka yïn abï thiëc ku ba rot "lel yïtök" të rɛ̈ɛ̈r yïn baaii ku cï ben liäp kek kɔc kök.

sourceString: The most severe restrictions are on travellers who have recently been to affected areas, but increasingly many countries are applying them to incoming travellers overall.
targetString: Löŋ rilic arëëtic ë bï cen raan caath në caar nhom ku wɛ̈ric, ku gɛth juëc aa lööŋ mäc kɔc puɔc keny alöŋ thïn.

sourceString: Some countries have even prohibited all or almost all foreigners from entry or limited the ability of local citizens and residents to leave.
targetString: Gɛth kök aacï kɔc pandɛ̈t gɛ̈l bïk cï bɛ̈n alöŋ thïn wula cäth ye kɔcken bai cɔl akor ic ku bïk cï ye jäl.

sourceString: What are the affected areas?
targetString: Ye bɛɛi kou nɔŋ yic tuany?

sourceString: Well, this is a fast-changing situation, and each country/region/organization has its own list of what areas are subject to restrictions.
targetString: Yen, ekenë e rɔt waar, dolat/dolat juëc/manadhama anɔŋ ajuiɛɛr de ɣan benë löŋ tau.

sourceString: The city of Wuhan is on every list and the rest of mainland China is on most.
targetString: Pan ye cɔl Wuhan yenëke dït xen thïn.

sourceString: Other areas that are often included: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Schengen Area as a whole, and sometimes various others.
targetString: Bɛ̈ɛ̈i kɔ̈k aye France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, Britania, Amërika ku jal ya bɛ̈ɛ̈i kɔ̈k kënë ke gɔ̈ɔ̈r ë tënë

sourceString: Some countries have imposed restrictions based on citizenship or residency from severely affected areas.
targetString: Gɛth juëc aacï kɔc ya gɛ̈l tëcït tën bï raan thïn wula raan e rɛ̈ɛ̈r bɛ̈ɛ̈i cï luaŋ iic.

sourceString: A detailed list of entry restrictions is maintained by the IATA.
targetString: Löŋ ebën aca ke gɔ̈ɔ̈r në waragɛk de IATA.

sourceString: It doesn't cover all the restrictions, but it's still useful.
targetString: Löŋ ebën a kënë gɔ̈ɔ̈r në ye waragɛk yic.

sourceString: Keep up to date—the outbreak and the travel restrictions are changing rapidly.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan lɔ̈ŋ cïkë täu kë ya nyic ne nyindhiɛ.

sourceString: For travel in the near future, consider making refundable reservations in case the changing situation forces you to change your plans.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan nyic mɛn löŋ kë alë bïkë waar në gɛɛr de köl ku thaar.

sourceString: Avoid buying tickets with a connection in an affected area – even changing planes can make you subject to restrictions.
targetString: Duk ɣɔ̈c athɔ̈r cäth ye të ye yen tiyara la pan cï kɔc luaŋ thïn - agut awɛ̈r ic tiyarat alɛ̈u bï cɔl apɛ̈n.

sourceString: Flights may get canceled with little notice, either due to the disease's spread and ever-changing entry restrictions, or simply because fewer people are flying and airlines are having trouble filling seats.
targetString: Kɔc ke riän nhial alë bïkë yï n cɔɔl ku luel kë wu ka cïn raan në ye köl ë të cïnë tuany rɔt thiit.

sourceString: You might also be delayed for hours upon arrival waiting for temperature checks and related procedures and paperwork, or even get quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Raan alë bï gau në cup de yic ke atuɔide kɔn them në thɛɛr. Raan alë bï rɛɛr të tök në wïïk ke rou acan bï kan xoi ke kën rɔt määt në kɔc yic.

sourceString: Be prepared for the possibility of disruption to your travel plans, especially if traveling internationally.
targetString: Akɔɔr ba nyic ke yïn bïnë cäth du ya gäu thölic acan yïn bï kan ya them to jäl lɔ në dola dɛtic.

sourceString: Even if you're nowhere near affected areas there's a risk that you'll have to stay at the destination longer than planned if you've shared a building or vessel with an infected person.
targetString: Cɔk alɔn cï yïn thiäk kek të wën la ic tuany ka ŋuɔt la kë jɔ̈ɔ̈r lɛ̈u bï yïn cɔl arɛ̈ɛ̈r bai kam bäric kek kɔc kök të cï yïn ɣɔ̈t rɔm kek raan dä wula käk ye kɔc ke lui rɔm kek raan cï luaŋ.

sourceString: For example, in late February an Italian doctor on vacation in Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) was diagnosed with COVID-19, and as a result all the guests in the hotel he stayed at were quarantined.
targetString: Acït mɛ̈n de dïktorɣɔn de pan ye cɔl Italy ɣɔn cï yök ke tuany në Akɔ̈nythii(Canary Islands) go kɔc ɣɔn rëër kenë yen yök eke tuany ë ya në COVID-19.

sourceString: Lockdowns and other internal restrictions
targetString: Thiɔ̈k de käŋ ku lööŋ juɛ̈c kɔ̈k cï akuma ke täu.

sourceString: Some countries and regions, especially severely affected ones, are implementing emergency lockdowns and restrictions on people's movements and activities, even for those who haven't recently been abroad.
targetString: Dolat juëc arëëtic acï caath ku ka juëc kɔ̈k wën ye loi thök ebën. Adït arët në bɛ̈ɛ̈i nɔŋ tuany arët.

sourceString: These include the temporary reintroduction of some border controls, restrictions on travel within the country, closing or limiting service at restaurants and other establishments, banning large public events, and in the most severe cases prohibiting people from leaving the house except for essential reasons.
targetString: Ka cï thök aye kä cït mɛn de ɣän ke cam ku caath ku thukul ku jal ya loiloi ka akuma ku jal ya bï raan cë jɛ̈l rɔt të cinë ke riilic.

sourceString: Beyond government restrictions, individual establishments are shutting their doors and cancelling events to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kɔc acï kä juëc kɔ̈k cït mɛn de thiëëk ku apalai thök acan bï tuany ë gël.

sourceString: In China, there are extensive restrictions on transportation and activity, which vary widely by province, city, and even by district or village.
targetString: Pan China, anaŋ kä ril ke thiöök cäth cï kek looi alɔŋ käk ye kɔc ke cath, ku aa wääc të ye luɔ̈i kek bɛ̈ɛ̈i tɔ̈u thïn, gendït, agut bɛ̈ɛ̈i kor wula ruup.

sourceString: Many governments recommend against traveling to China at this time.
targetString: Akumat juëc arëëtic acï kɔc kën yök bïke lɔ Chaina piɔl agut cï thaar benë ye tuany thök.

sourceString: If you have no choice, do your research and get up-to-date information about the local situation wherever you are going.
targetString: Akɔɔr ba pan lɛ̈i yïn thïn kan nyic mɛn täu tuany thïn wenë liu.

sourceString: People who have traveled to Hubei face particularly severe restrictions.
targetString: Kɔc wën cï lɔ pan cin löŋ täu a retic akɔɔr bïke nyïn ya tïït arët.

sourceString: Examples of restrictions that you may encounter in some parts of China (this is not an exhaustive list):
targetString: Käk cï kek pɛ̈ɛ̈n lëu ba kek yɔ̈k pan China abak (ku ace yen thök käk cï kek gät piny):

sourceString: 14-day quarantine, self-quarantine, or COVID-19 test upon arrival from other parts of China or from other countries, at your expense
targetString: Löŋ acï täu cït mɛn de bï raan ya ca rɛ̈ɛ̈r të tök në nïn ke 14 ke ci  rɔt thiëk kɔc, ku bï raan ya them në cup de yic pan dɛ̈t, wälë thëm ë COVID-19 të bëi raan bei ɣänë China wälë bɛ̈i kɔ̈k yic, në kuthärɛtku.

sourceString: questions about your travel and medical history (lying can get you years in prison)
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan tuany de ya nyic luel apiɛth acan na lɔ yïn yök ke yïn pïït ke yïn bï täu xɔ̈n de döm në run.

sourceString: mandatory registration using an online or paper form
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan ebën waragɛk thiɔ̈ɔ̈ŋ.

sourceString: requirement to wear a face mask in public
targetString: Acï täu ke ye lööŋ bï raan ye wum ya kum.

sourceString: people who have been outside of China within 14 days not allowed into public places like malls
targetString: Akuma de Chaina ë jam wu raan ë bɔ̈ pan pei abï ya ca rɛ̈ɛ̈r të tök në nïn ke 14 acan bï kan xoi.

sourceString: shops only accept mobile payments, not cash
targetString: Pan de Chaina ke kɔc aye wëu tuɔɔc të nɔŋ raan de dukan ku cï wëth guɔ̈p yen gɛmë.

sourceString: restaurants, transportation and other establishments refusing service to non-Chinese citizens
targetString: Kɔc ke pan ye cɔl Chaina ace kɔc ke pan dɛ̈t ë piɔl bïke lɔ cam në matamic ku ka cïke ke ye ca caath në riɛi.

sourceString: many forms of transportation reduced or shut down
targetString: Akuma de Chaina acï caath de riɛi ebën thök thok.

sourceString: mandatory real-name registration for public transit cards
targetString: Akɔɔr kë bï raan ebën naŋ waragɛk dɛ̈n de riɛi.

sourceString: access in and out of a town, village, or city completely blocked
targetString: Käŋ kedhiɛ geeu ku xan mɛc kenë geeu acï ke thök.

sourceString: non-resident visitors prohibited from entering apartment complexes
targetString: Raan ebën cï lɔ Chaina në ye nïn ke tuany ë acï piɔl bï cääth.

sourceString: only allowed to go outside once every two days to get supplies
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan ya lɔ bië në köl tök ku ber rëër baai ke cï lɔ thuuk në nïn ke rou.

sourceString: businesses, activities, and attractions closed
targetString: Dukɛ̈ɛ̈n ebën acï ke thök thok.

sourceString: businesses need local government permission to re-open
targetString: Dukɛ̈ɛ̈n abï leu të cïnë akuma ye luel.

sourceString: restaurants (if they are even open) require a minimum distance between customers
targetString: Xan ke cam akɔɔr benë kɔc ke yic amec.

sourceString: selling substandard face masks has a maximum sentence of life imprisonment
targetString: Raan yök ke xɔc ke ye yenë kɔc ke wum kum abï täu xöl de döm.

sourceString: As of mid-March 2020, Europe is the epicenter of the epidemic, and many European countries have closed their borders to international travel - only border commuters and freight are allowed to cross.
targetString: Në Akold̈it yic 2020, Europe acen rɔt tau thïn, bɛɛi juëc ke ̈Europe acï akɛth thök thook- aye kɔc ë lui thuuk në nyindhiɛ yenëke tëëk.

sourceString: Also businesses other than food stores and pharmacies are closed, and public transport has been reduced or stopped.
targetString: Matam ku pan akim aŋot kekë lui ku ka juëc kɔ̈k kë acï thök.

sourceString: In the worst affected countries including Italy, Spain and France, lockdowns like in China in January, have been implemented.
targetString: Pan cït mɛn de Chaina ku Italy ku France acï käŋ thök thok ebën.

sourceString: As well the EU has closed its outer borders.
targetString: Ku na cë EU akɛthken bec thiök thook.

sourceString: COVID-19 is prevalent also in North America.
targetString: Tuany ye cɔl COVID-19 acï gël bï kɔc ce dɔm pan ye cɔl North America

sourceString: The borders between Canada, the U.S., and Mexico are closed to non-essential travel, and in many areas bans on big gatherings are in effect (this means places like restaurants are closed, and events are canceled).
targetString: Akɛɛth ke bɛ̈ɛ̈i yekë cɔl Canada ku America ku Mexico acï ke thök thok ebën, ku ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n juëc iic akuötnhom acï pɛ̈ɛ̈n (ku ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n cïmen matamat aacï ke thiök, ku käk ye looi aacï tem kɔ̈th).

sourceString: Numerous state, county, and municipal jurisdictions have issued stay-at-home orders that require all nonessential businesses to close.
targetString: Bɛ̈ɛ̈i juëc, gɛu, ku ɣɔ̈ɔ̈n gendit cɔl Municipal aacï kɔc yɔ̈ɔ̈k bï kɔc ya rɛ̈ɛ̈r baai ku awïc käk wën cïmen kë wïc kek apɛi bï ke thiöök thook.

sourceString: With lots of flights canceled, warnings issued, and restrictions imposed, flying in the time of coronavirus can be a challenge.
targetString: Ku rin cï tirayat pɛ̈ɛ̈n bïk cï cath, kɔc acï ke lɛ̈k bïk cï ben cath, ku käk kök cï kek pɛ̈ɛ̈n, cäth dhaman coronavirus abï ic riɛl.

sourceString: Some routes are not possible.
targetString: Thɔ̈l kɔ̈k acï thök ebën.

sourceString: Others will require more inconvenient connections than usual—multiple stops and long waits between flights.
targetString: Pan ŋootë kɔc ëke caath në thayara ayenë raan nyin de tit arëëtic.

sourceString: In some cases that means more expensive tickets.
targetString: Yen cääth de thayara ë wëu juëc arëëtic.

sourceString: On the other hand, the good news is that many flights are cheaper than usual due to decreased demand, and there's a decent chance you'll get an empty seat next to you.
targetString: Tök piɛth në yekënë yic acï wëu thayara nhïïm tɔu piny acan acïn kɔc juëc ber caath në thayara.

sourceString: Build in extra time for your connections, especially if transferring from an international flight to a domestic flight and especially if your itinerary involves a country that's seriously affected.
targetString: Acï yic piɔl emënë acan bï raan lɔ pan dïtë tuany thïn ku jol yic ariilic arët në bɛɛi dïtë tuany thïn.

sourceString: Screenings, temperature checks, extra paperwork, and the associated waiting around can add minutes or hours before you're allowed to continue on your journey.
targetString: Aŋot raan ke kën guɔ lɔ në thayara yic, ke yïn yenë atuɔi kan them.

sourceString: You may find it harder than usual to buy a ticket to or from a destination subject to warnings and restrictions.
targetString: Acï yic riɛl arët acan ba tharaya yök ke lɔ pan dïtë tuany thïn.

sourceString: This is a real concern if you're trying to get out of an affected area.
targetString: Arilic arët bï raan jal pan dïtë tuany thïn.

sourceString: For instance, most aggregators are not selling tickets from China to the United States (presumably to avoid falling afoul of restrictions and being on the hook for a passenger's flight out).
targetString: Arilic emɛnë acan bï (raan thayara yök ke jël pan ye cɔl Chaina ke lɔ pan ye cɔl America).

sourceString: To buy a ticket for an itinerary like this, you may have to contact the airline or use a lesser-known aggregator.
targetString: A can ba ɣöc,  aŋot ke cï yic kɔɔc bï raan thayara yök emɛnë.

sourceString: Another possibility is to buy two separate tickets (for instance, a ticket from China to Cambodia and a second ticket from Cambodia to the U.S.), but be careful you won't get quarantined or lose your luggage in between.
targetString: Këdɛ̈t lëu rɔt e ŋuan bï raan tem në tikit kerou tɛ̈k thok (në tïŋde käläŋ, tikit lɛ̈l China lɔ Cambodia ku këde rou e tikit jɛ̈l Cambodia lɔ U.S.), lakin tïëtë nyin bë yï cuɔ̈k lawɛ̈ŋ yïtök wälë mär käku cɛɛl ë tënë.

sourceString: Connecting flights can be a problem.
targetString: Thayara ë jäl ke lɔ në bɛ̈ɛ̈i juëc cï abï yic riɛl.

sourceString: The risk of getting stuck in the connection city is higher than usual right now, due to delays for screening and testing as well as extensive cancellations.
targetString: Kɛk alë bï tɔu në bɛɛi dït kë yic emenë, acan gaau de them dït ku bï caath tem kɔu atɔu eya.

sourceString: Connecting in an affected area may lead to entry restrictions later on, and if you've been in an affected area recently some countries won't even let you change planes.
targetString: Arilic arëëtic acan bï raan lɔ pan nɔŋ ë tuany ku na yï tɔ̈u pan dït ë tuany thïn

sourceString: On certain itineraries there is a risk of getting quarantined somewhere along the way.
targetString: Raan cï lɔ pan dɛt alë bï ca rɛ̈ɛ̈r të tök ke cï lɔ caath.

sourceString: So book a direct flight if you can, and if not, think carefully about where to connect.
targetString: Akɔɔr ba rëër të tök të ye yïn ye tïŋ ke yïn bï lɔ kɛɛk pan peei.

sourceString: In uncertain times, plans can change.
targetString: Kë ca kiir alë bï yic riäk në geer de thaar.

sourceString: Many embassies and consulates have evacuated nonessential staff, and some have shut down operations completely.
targetString: Akumat wën ye loi Pan peei acï kake thök thok ebën.

sourceString: Emergency assistance should still be available, though it's possible you may have to contact a further-away consulate if your local one has shut down.
targetString: Kuɔny abï ŋuɔt arɛ̈ɛ̈r thïn, cɔk alɔn lɛ̈u yen rot ku ba raan muk nyin bɛ̈ny ic cɔl, të cï kedun baai thiöök.

sourceString: If you have been stranded due to the pandemic, your nearest consulate may be able to help you find a flight home, arrange an emergency loan so you can buy a ticket, or provide an emergency passport.
targetString: Ku na ca gäk pandä rin tuany kënë, ka bɛ̈nydun thiök kek yïn alɛ̈u bï kony ku ba tiyara yɔ̈k bï yïn ke la baai, guir ba den yɔ̈k ku bï yïn ke athɔ̈r cäth ɣɔɔc, wula

sourceString: At the very least they can keep you informed about the local situation and notify you about recently introduced travel requirements and restrictions.
targetString: Kë lɛ̈u bï looi e wɛ̈t ku bï yïn a lɛ̈k ke looi rot baai ku ye yï lɛ̈k käk cï kek luel alɔŋ käk wïc la keny ic ku käk cï kek pɛ̈ɛ̈n.

sourceString: Ordinary consular services such as visa and passport processing may be suspended or restricted to urgent need, depending on the location and the consulate.
targetString: Bï bei athɔ̈r luɔi ku athɔ̈r cäth abï dhiɛl tem kɔ̈u wula bï cɔl akor ic bï ya kɔc wïc yen apɛi kek ye yiɛ̈k yen, ku e tëcït tën abi ku të rɛ̈ɛ̈r bɛ̈ny munk nyin muɔr-ŋaknhom thïn.

sourceString: Although some people call the disease "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Wuhan disease", or "Chinese virus", the use of these terms is considered racist in China and by many people of Chinese origin.
targetString: Tuany ë a dɔm raan ëbɛ̈n acäk ka mɛn ye kɔc kɔ̈k ye cɔl tuany de pan ye cɔl Wuhan ama kɔ̈m de Chinese ku kɔc juɛɛc ken ke kä kë luel yen në china.

sourceString: It is still common to refer the disease as "Wuhan pneumonia" or "Chinese virus" in places like Hong Kong and Taiwan.
targetString: Aye kɔc kɔ̈k ŋot kë luel kë wu ye tuanyë ë këde pan ye cɔl Wuhan në kë yënë ye luel wu ye kɔ̈m de china në kɔc ke Hong Kong ku Taiwan.

sourceString: To be safe, use location-neutral terms when referring to the disease, such as "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", or just "the virus" or "the pandemic".
targetString: Acï kɔɔr bï COVID-19 ë ya cɔl në rin ke pan ɣe dɔm ɣe ku ye tuany de pinynhom.

sourceString: Particularly in developing countries where law enforcement are poorly trained, enforcement of curfew, lockdown or stay-at-home orders are often brutal, often using forces not proportionate against crowds.
targetString: Ku tën bɛ̈ɛ̈i kïc rɔ̈t gui , kïc apuruuk ken ŋiɛc piöc apath, pɛ̈n cäth wäkɔ̈u, thiök piny wula lööŋ rɛ̈ɛ̈r baai aaya ke ac, apuruuk aa kɔc luc.

sourceString: Comply with these orders, and avoid crowds in public.
targetString: Akɔɔr bï raan piny apiɛth ku rëër bai.

sourceString: As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, xenophobia has risen in many countries, primarily but not exclusively targeting people perceived to be Chinese.
targetString: Tuany ë acï tiel dït bɛ̈i në kɔc yïn. Kɔc kɔ̈k aye kɔc cï mïth ke baai yɔŋ.

sourceString: There has been a worldwide spike in racist incidents targeting people of East Asian origin, including in major cities such as New York, London and San Francisco.
targetString: Jam aci dït në bɛ̈ɛ̈i kɔ̈kiic në biäk de kë yenë kɔc rɔt tet ku aa kɔc pan ke bɔ̈ alɔŋ Asia aa kek cï ke thuör bei, ku aala iic bɛ̈ɛ̈idït cïmɛn New York, London ku San Francisco.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, Sinophobia, which was already high to begin with, has intensified as a result of the pandemic, with the result that many shops and restaurants are now denying service to mainland Chinese customers and banning Mandarin speakers from their premises (with the exception of Taiwanese).
targetString: Në Hong Kong, ke atekthok acï dït arëëtic në ke thɛɛr ke ye tuanyë, acï lɔ në gudhur yenë kɔc ce Chinese pɛ̈n bïkë ɣɔc thuuk(aye Taiwanese kek ka ya ɣɔ̈c).

sourceString: Levels of xenophobia have also risen in East Asia, with some restaurants and other businesses in Japan and China refusing service to foreign customers.
targetString: Atekthok acï dït ë ya pan ye cɔl Asia. Aye kɔc ke pan peei pɛ̈n xöc në matamic ku jal ya thukic ebën.

sourceString: In China, there have been incidents of foreigners being refused rooms by hotel staff, and foreign residents, particularly black people, being kicked out of their apartments on short notice by their landlords.
targetString: Pan ye cɔl Chaina ace kɔc ya pɛ̈n bï xöt ke tɔc ya juur në mïth ke pan peei. Acë ke ye ca xöc në ka cam ke ë ya.

sourceString: Sources for further information on the coronavirus outbreak include:
targetString: Ɣän kɔ̈k yenë ke thön ë dhoŋ bec de coronavirus anɔŋic yïk:

sourceString: The US government Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
targetString: Kɔc ke gël de tuany pan de kawaja Ɣän ke Gël ku tïtë nyin e Tuany në akuma de US.

sourceString: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (daily updates)
targetString: Kɔc ke gël de tuany pan ya cɔl Europe.

sourceString: United Kingdom government, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers
targetString: Kɔc ke gël de tuany pan ye cɔl Britania acï thɔn në biäk de tuany.

sourceString: An online map and dashboard from the John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering with live updates
targetString: Jamia de raan ye cɔl John Hopki acï cabaka benë wël ke ye tuany ya yök loi.

sourceString: Partial lists of entry restrictions from IATA and The New York Times
targetString: Pan ye cɔl New York acï IATA ku Löŋ ke gël de rɔth täu.

sourceString: A variety of misinformation and conspiracy theories about the virus are being promoted online and even by some government officials, so be careful which sources you check for information.
targetString: Käk kïc ke deetic apiɛth në biäk de ye tuanyë aaye ke luel webthaid nyin agut bäny akuma juëc, tit rot apath alɔŋ të ye yïn wɛ̈l yɔ̈k thïn.

sourceString: Ensure that all information and advice you receive has been backed by reputable doctors and scientists.
targetString: Akɔɔr ba ya piŋ aye wɛ̈t cï dïktor luel acan yenë ka nyic ka juëc ke ye tuanyë.

sourceString: In a crisis, it's natural to want to keep following the latest updates, but it may be better for your mental health to moderate the amount of news that you look at, and stick to reliable news sources.
targetString: Acï rac bï raan ya piŋ në käk yenë luel në biäk de ye tuanyë ku ka cï piɛth ba ya piŋ në wël ce yith wën në bïke yïn riääc abac.

sourceString: If you normally watch the news twice per day then stick to this schedule and do something else, rather than having the 24-hour news on continuously.
targetString: Na ye daai në wël yam në vido yïn na thɛɛr ke 24 ke ka apiɛth ba ya loi wuyi ku du ber ya piŋ në wël kɔ̈k wën cë yith.

sourceString: b'Bat SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), also sometimes called SARS-like coronavirus WIV1, is a strain of Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) isolated from Chinese rufous horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus sinicus).
targetString: b'Bat SARS cï mɛn de kɔ̈m de Korona WIV1 (Aliik SL-CoV-WIV1), ëye cɔl SARS-thöŋ kekë coronavirus WIV1 ëyɛ, anɔŋ tuany dɛt cï rɔt caal ke (SARSr-CoV)rɔt ke yen. Tuanyë ayök në läi gup läi cït mɛn da agok, ku alïïk ku ajɔŋkör(kïn).

sourceString: Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
targetString: Cë mënë coronaviruses kedhiɛ, bairäth anɔŋ abil-töŋ nɔŋic-tuany RNA tɔ̈ në biɔŋdeic.

sourceString: The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Aye dïktor juëc  luel wu tuanyë aa yök SARS-CoV kë tɔ̈ në alïïk guɔ̈p. Acë dïktor juëc gam ke yic

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
targetString: Aye akuma de chainïth wu ɣokde SARS e jäl në alïïk guɔ̈p ku lër në raan guɔ̈p.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Loi de wal de ye tuanyye cɔl COVID-19 yeneka luɔi ë pinynhom thïn. Wal abï thil loi në wiik be ben tueŋ ago tuany de 2019-20 korona tök (COVID-19).

sourceString: The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.
targetString: Akutnhom cɔl WHO de ajuir de ye tuanyë acï raan 536 them acan bï wal loi. Ekenë abï thil loi. Kɔc akɔɔr bikë ya tök ëya të cike pial në COVID-19.

sourceString: In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Në Köl ic, APMP ecë "Athëmë KƆ̈C ATÖK" jɔɔk tënë bi ke 10 luɔi ë wal them në dolat ke 10 yic.Aken ye wal ke ŋuan ke ka ke them ke binë ke ̈COVID-19 tök.

sourceString: A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.
targetString: Kɔc ake cï nyuc piny ku them ke bikë wal de ye tuanyë loi në Bildït 2020 go ke göök. Wal de ye tuany ye cɔl COVID-19 abï thïl loi në run ke ŋuan wenë run ke dhïc.

sourceString: Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
targetString: Loide wal de ye tuanyë abï run juëc jɔt. Yen ë loi de ye wëlë wenë ka tɔu ë dïktor ke pinynhom thïn.

sourceString: It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.
targetString: Ekenë anɔŋë bï FDA kaciip loi në kam gup ku läi gup ëya, ku wäl yam abï ɣäth bï them kɔc gup pankïm, ku awïc bï kaŋ thany cök të bï ye ɣäth thuuk thïn ku bï la ɣaac wei.

sourceString: Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
targetString: Loi de ye wal de COVID-19 akɔɔr benë ka juëc kɔn liap ɣɔ̈n de kacip. Loide ye walë acï gɔl ku ka bï nin juëc jɔt.

sourceString: New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
targetString: Anɔŋ ka juëc (NCEs aye cɔl new molecular entitirs wenë NMEs)bikë kɔn liap të loië wɛl de ye tuanyë.

sourceString: These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
targetString: Wɛl bï̈ loië abï yic nɔŋ ke bï tuany ye cɔl COVID-19 dac ya nɔk. Kenë abï̈ rɔt loi amääth.

sourceString: At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
targetString: Wal acï gɔl ë loi ku loi ben ya loi ë guɔpic aŋot ke kenë nyic cï mɛn de loi de në NCE.

sourceString: It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
targetString: Abï ya loi de akutnhom de tuany acan bï loi de wal nyic në raan guɔp. Wal abï kɔn them miak në kɔc kɔk gup.

sourceString: A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).
targetString: Kë rilic aret ekenë ë bï wal loi ku bï nyic ye dek adik. Acan wal akɔɔr bï tau ke cï dit aretic ku ce ber kuur aretic. Ekenë yenë ka luië kɔc thïn. Abï kan them në raan guɔp ("first-in-human" [FIH] wenë first human dose [FHD,] aaye cɔl "first-in-man"[FIM]).

sourceString: In addition, drug development must establish the physicochemical properties of the NCE: its chemical makeup, stability, and solubility.
targetString: Ëya dɛŋ, ke wal akɔɔr bïnë luɔi de nyic ë gup yic cï mɛn de NCE:Akɔɔr bï nyic ëya ëke bï täu në walic.

sourceString: Manufacturers must optimize the process they use to make the chemical so they can scale up from a medicinal chemist producing milligrams, to manufacturing on the kilogram and ton scale.
targetString: Kɔc ye wɛl guir bec adhil bïk dhɛ̈lkɛn ye kek ke wɛl loi cök apiɛth agokï them në baŋde akïm e wɛlthii ke miligäm loi, agut cë guër bec në kilo ku jɔla medhänia de ton.

sourceString: They further examine the product for suitability to package as capsules, tablets, aerosol, intramuscular injectable, subcutaneous injectable, or intravenous formulations.
targetString: Abï wäl kan ku tiëŋkë të bën piɛth thïn ku bï loi keye kapthul, wäl ye dek, aerosol. Wäl ye tuɔm kök ic, wäl ye tuɔm aŋuem ic, wula wɛl kɔ̈k ye luɔ̈i në guöp ic.

sourceString: Together, these processes are known in preclinical and clinical development as chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC).Many aspects of drug development focus on satisfying the regulatory requirements of drug licensing authorities.
targetString: Ka kedhiɛ̈ abikë loi ago wal loi ke bï ye tuany lëu cï mɛn de (CMC). Aŋot wal ke kenë lɔm, ke ka bi kan them në kɔc kɔk gup ku bï tiŋ mɛn bï lui.

sourceString: These generally constitute tests designed to determine the major toxicities of a novel compound prior to first use in humans.
targetString: Ekenë abï yic nak them de wal mɛn loi. Ku bï ke ye riak në gup yic dac tïŋ.

sourceString: The Canadian government announced CA$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian universities, with plans to establish a "vaccine bank" of new vaccines for implementation if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Akuma de pan ye cɔl Canada acï CA$275 million yök bï yɛ̈ɛ̈n akutnhiim ke 96 de juiɛ̈ɛ̈r de COVID-19. wal kony në wëu juëc aretic. Wëu kë abikë yök në baŋic.

sourceString: Clinical trial programs involve three, multiple-year stages toward product approval, and a fourth, post-approval stage for ongoing safety monitoring of the vaccine or drug therapy:
targetString: Thëm de wal në kɔc kɔk gup bikë run jɔt ku jal wal bɛn gɔl në dëk. Kɔc bikë yëk ë welë abikë kan ɣoi ku tiŋ mɛn në ke bï loi në guup ken yic.

sourceString: Phase I trials, usually in healthy volunteers, determine safety and dosing.
targetString: Atëk athëëmathëëm ë I, e colke tɔ tëde pial ë kɔcë rɔt gam abac, e pial nyuɔth ku të yenë wɛl dekthïn.

sourceString: Phase II trials are used to establish an initial reading of efficacy and further explore safety in small numbers of people having the disease targeted by the NCE.
targetString: Atëk athëëmthëëm ë II aaye loi bïnë ke akuën ajöök luɔi cök piny bï kä piɛth ya bëi bei ku be caath thok yen pial në adɛnë  kɔc nɔŋ tuany cï ke wɛl kɔc nyïn në NCE.

sourceString: Phase III trials are large, pivotal trials to determine safety and efficacy in sufficiently large numbers of people with the COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Atëk athëëm ë III aathëëmdït tɔ ciɛl ago pial ya nyuɔth ku bï kä piɛth ya bëi bei në adɛndït ë kɔc lëu rɔt cë wuɔk në KOBIT-19

sourceString: If safety and efficacy are adequately proved, clinical testing may stop at this step and the NCE advances to the new drug application (NDA) stage to begin marketing.
targetString: Na ye pial ku bëi bei ë kë piɛth e kë ye tɔ̈ ë cï det, cär akïïm alëu bë köc e cöök käic ku NCE alɔtueŋ kenë dhöl yennë wɛl jöt yeke täu(WJT) ago jöök bë thuuk  rot jɔɔk.

sourceString: Phase IV trials are post-approval trials that may be a condition attached by the FDA, also called post-market surveillance studies.
targetString: Atëk athëëmthëëm ë IV aaye ya kä cï ke dac gam ëke lëu bï ke ya thany në kɔc gup në FDA, E  cɔl ëyɛ akuën ë cärde thuŋ tueŋ.

sourceString: In addition to the tests required to move a novel vaccine or antiviral drug into the clinic for the first time, manufacturers must ensure that any long-term or chronic toxicities are well-defined, including effects on systems not previously monitored (fertility, reproduction, immune system, among others).
targetString: Në kë juɛkë thïn tënë thëëmthëëm e wïc bïnë ke wal ë tiëtë guöp nyai wälë wal e bairäth gël në panakïmic në gɔ̈cdeic tueŋ, duguɛ̈ɛ̈r e ke guär bec adhil bïk ya täu në kë nhom yen kuatë kë bääric wälë tuany cë lakuak në guöpic aaye ke nyiɛc cätic, anɔŋ yïk kë ye loi në guöpic këcë nyïn dac tïït(luɔide käkë dhiët, dhiëth, käkë guöp titic lɔŋthïn në kökic).

sourceString: In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
targetString: Në lɔŋ Amërika, ë ajuɛr kënë aaye cɔl "wɛl jöt yeke täu" wäle WJT.

sourceString: A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
targetString: Athëm akïm cï täu në lɔ tueŋic  alëu bï bɛr cökpiny kë "ye kë guɔ löömë lɔ tueŋic" na lɔ kä juakrɔt cë ke wëŋ tënë thëm le kë ë ëye thöŋic ë kɔc piöth  në baŋde  täde tuany wäle liude në luɔide në piath de yïlac.

sourceString: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
targetString: Köc de pinynhom ëbën atök ku akutnhom de Irupïn kɔr thëëmthëëm cök tënë kɔc cï ke tääc panakïm cë wuɔk apɛi në KOBIT-19 bïk kä cï ke nyiëc täu agokï käk athëëm ger cë  nëtïja ke ŋuan ɣɔn cëke them në käkë takatit e tuöl.

sourceString: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
targetString: Kä cï ke nyiëc tɔ̈ thïn në lɔtuɛŋ Atëk de II-III de athëëm akïm tënë raan lëu bï ajuɛrde athëëm ë thää de pial kɔu guɔ tɛɛm ku loi käke piööc lik, ku juɛk atɛk lëu bïnë ye dac temkɔu wälë tiäm, ajuɛr kuany cök ë gɛra tënë thëm cï rok në ɣänkɛn ë pinynhom.

sourceString: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
targetString: Kɔc juëc e wɛl loi(NCEs) aaye wuïk në dhamɛnë luöi ë wäl, e lɔn cën kek kë cë käŋë dac riöök wälë e wët ce kekë rɔt yöök ëke gamke në luɔiic apiɛth tënë tuany wɛ̈n cï wël kɔc nyïïn, cë më cïnë ye nyuɔth në Atëk de II-III athëëmthëëm akïm.

sourceString: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
targetString: Adɛndït wuïk apɛi cï thäny thok kekë lɔtueŋde ɣöötë wal aaye ke cɔl "kä cë dhär",  wïcë atëk në dhamɛnden ë kurë nyin ë lɔtueŋë luɔi de wal ago ajuɛr dac "nɔ̈k" ago wuïk cë dhoŋ kɔc luɔi kɔc.

sourceString: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
targetString: Akuën töŋë 2010 acë käŋ kerou caathic kä yennë ke wëu juaar ku kä ye ŋɛk wëu bëi bei në jemdeic tënë bɛ̈i de wäl tök në thukic kë ye biliöön 1.8 wënh Amërika ku mïliöön  870 wënh Amerika, në kuënyë köudɛnic

sourceString: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
targetString: Cin cɛlic ë mɛkic de 2015-16 athëëm de lɔtueŋ de wal ke 10 ë kantha e cï yöök kë ye mïliöön 648 wënh Amërika.

sourceString: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
targetString: Në 2016 ic dhukë tïŋde wal ë kɔc wɛɛrka 106 e cï caathic në athëëmthëëm akïm, go adɛt de wëu cï gam tënë raan ye wal loi cï gam në baŋde Atëk athëëmthëëm de III e ye 2.6  bilïöön në wëu Amërika(në 2013 ic dollär), në wëu juak rɔt në 8.5% ë  ruön

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
targetString: Athëëmthëëm kedhorou aake laath wal cï ke gam wɛ̈nthɛɛr wïc bï kë yäth bec ic ago juäi ya alacu, nɔŋ yïk akuën ka ŋuan në baŋde kolorkuin ë nyin aapïu wälë kolorkuin ë ubup.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Walë bairäth nɔ̈k cï ke bɛ dhukï yïk kë yekï loi aakek nɔŋ amɛtnhom ë yɔɔpë Cainith, kekë Atëk athëëmthëëm ë III ka 9 tënë remdethibir në bɛi kuötic në wëtë guɛl në thök Akɔ̈nydït.

sourceString: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
targetString: E wɛt Bill ku Melind e ɣöt thok ee jöök kekë kɔc mɛt kekë ye juak milïöön 125 wënh Amërika ë ŋɔr kekë Akutnhom ë Pinynhom Mëtë Pial, kë ye KOBIT-19 cɔkë pialde dɛc dhuk piny jöök në Kol ic, bë luɔide wal juir tënë kɔc ë ye kɔɔr cök cɔkë lɔtueŋ  agokï dac deet, caath, juirkï bë lɔtueŋ, ku themkï kɔu bïk yïlany lëu bë piath bëi bei.

sourceString: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
targetString: Akutnhom akïm gör yïlany ë KOBIT-19 cï juir agokï ke cin mat në luɔi ku juakkï nëtïja tënɔŋ athëëm akïm de pinynhom në yïlany piɛth lëu bï loi kë raan cë wuɔɔk.

sourceString: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
targetString: Në gɔ̈cë 2020, wɛlke bairäth kuöt yennë ke tuɛnytuɛny  ë wuɔɔk kök alacu cï ke thääpë gɛmbec wälë loi në dhël jöt në kɔrë cökdït akïm ago tuanyde KOBIT-19 jatnyin nhial.

sourceString: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Tënë wal cï ke dac gam wënthɛɛr(cït yïk kolorkuin ë nyin pïu de juäi), Atëk athëëmthëëm ë III-IV e nyuɔth në buɔɔtic agut cë buɔɔt thiär cë wuɔɔk në KOBIT-19 yen të bïnë wal cï gam wënthɛɛr luɔi thïn në të yennë wuɔkë KOBIT-19 alacu thïn.

sourceString: As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
targetString: Në jöökde Akɔ̈nydït de 2020, kɔc ke 103 ëke tɔ̈ në ajuɛrë pial cök aake tɔ̈ në kän akïmic wälë kana de lɔtueŋ Atëk ë I-IV, kekë athëëm ë wal 29 de kɔc wɛɛr ŋöthke në kɔc piöth në Akanythii ic.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.
targetString: Në Kol ic, go Akutnhom ë Pinynhom ë Mɛtë Pial(APMP) e cë "athëëmde köc atök" luɔnybec në bëi ke 10 ic ago kɔc cë wuɔk në KOBIT-19 ke buɔt thiär në kä piɛth tɔ̈ lëu bë wal ë bairäth cɔke tɔ̈ ku jɔla käke lui ë wal dëpe guɔp ŋot ë ke kënë ke guɔ them në wɛtë tuany de KOBIT-19.

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
targetString: Nɔŋ gɛrë wal lëu bë nïn ë thou dhuɔk piny?

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
targetString: Nɔŋ gɛrë wal lëu bë thää ayaan cïnë ye tääc panakïm dhuɔk piny?

sourceString: Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
targetString: Ee naŋ yïlaacɛt nɔŋ kë rɛɛc kï në kä wïc kɔc tuany në KOBIT-19-lëu bë tuany alir në piöuic ago naŋ yom e bën wälë tëuë tënë käke tïtë nyin?

sourceString: Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.
targetString: Lëu bë ë wɛlkä loi bïnë ke wuɔk ë tuany ë KOBIT-19 kuɔr nyin piny tënë kɔc ë nyïn tït  në pialë guöp ku kɔc nɔŋ purtha lëu bï kek yöök kekë tuany rilic? Götë rin piny ë kɔc cë wuɔk në KOBIT-19 aye loi ë piɔlic në luɔi ë käthii kor yeke lɛɛr thin, nɔŋ yïk pälde wɛt cï rok, tënë wɛpthait  de APMP

sourceString: After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
targetString: Na cï duthëëm nyuɔth kek wɛl tɔ̈ panakïm, kë wɛpthait de APMP ka gɛm käke piööc cï täu panakïm tënë wal töŋë wɛl cï ke them wälë yïlany cï panakïm täu ë yennë nyïn tït në tuany de KOBIT-19.

sourceString: The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
targetString: Duthëm akïm e göt piny ku toc thön ë kuënyë cök në baŋ ë täde këdë ku yïlaac, thɛ̈ɛ̈p tëuë käthii kor në lɔŋde APMP wɛpthait de köc atök.

sourceString: A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
targetString: Akut de pinynhom e nyin tït ë pial ë dïktoor de APMP e nëtïja cekic nyuɔth ago kony në atëk lacar ku piathde wɛl cï ke them, ku ger kuer thëmic wälë cëët dhöl piɛth lëu bï tuany dhuk piny.

sourceString: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.
targetString: E kë thöŋ kë kuën thiäk- këkë intërnɛt ago köc atök, ye cɔl "lɔɔr cë rit", e jöök cök në Kol ë bëiic ke dhorou në INSERM(Parïth, Prɛny). Në dhamɛn ë Akänydït, ajuër athëëm ë köc atök aacë ɣet 108 miliön wëu Amërika tënɔŋ 203,000 ë tök ku tök, akuut mët ku akuma kekë bëi ke 45 cë mɛt tënë mënyde wëu wälë athëëmde kɔc muuk.

sourceString: Numerous candidate drugs under study as "supportive" treatments to relieve discomfort during illness, such as NSAIDs or bronchodilators, are not included in the table below.
targetString: Wɛl juëc wɛ̈ɛ̈r tɔ̈ në kuën cök ëke "dukuny" de yïlac ago agänygäny waar në thää dɛ tuany,cït yïk NSAIDs wälë wal e kɔc guup lapälpiny aace ke ë täu thïn në kuɛɛr tɔ̈ ciën kä.

sourceString: Others in early-stage Phase II trials or numerous treatment candidates in Phase I trials, are also excluded.
targetString: Kɔk në kana cë dac jöök de Atëk athëëmthëëm ë II wälë yïlaccɛt kuut wɛ̈ɛ̈r tɔ̈ në Atëk athëëm ë I aaye nyai thïn ëyɛ.

sourceString: Drug candidates in Phase I-II trials have a low rate of success (under 12%) to pass through all trial phases to gain eventual approval.
targetString: Wal wɛ̈ɛ̈r tɔ̈ në Atëk athëëmthëëm ë I-II anɔŋ tiäm kor nyin(12%) ago tëëk në atëm ë  thëm kedhiɛ ago yöök kekë gɛ̈m.

sourceString: Hydroxychloroquine is more commonly available than chloroquine in the United States.
targetString: Kolorkuin e nyin pïu yene gäkë tɔ̈ arëtic në kolorkuin ë ubup pinyide Amërika.

sourceString: Although several countries use chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for treatment of persons hospitalized with COVID-19, as of March 2020 the drug has not been formally approved through clinical trials in the United States.
targetString: Ë cɔkaa lɔn ë ye bëi  juëc kolorokuin ë ubup wälë kolorkuin e nyin pïu loi kë yë këde yïlany ë kɔc cï ke tääc panakïm kekë KOBIT-19, mënë Kol de 2020 kë wal akëcë  guɔ gam bï lui në baŋde athëëmthëëm akïm tënë Amërika.

sourceString: Chloroquine has been recommended by Chinese, South Korean and Italian health authorities for the treatment of COVID-19, although these agencies and the US CDC noted contraindications for people with heart disease or diabetes.
targetString: Kolorkuin acï Cainïth cäät ë pɛth, Thɔ̈th Koriɛn ku pial akuma de Itali në yïlany de KOBIT-19, ë cɔk ë kek ë dutuuc kä ku US CDC aye tïŋ  yen të ye kek rɔ̈t luuŋ thïn tënɔŋ kɔc kök nɔŋ tuany në ke piɔ̈th wälë thukäri.

sourceString: Both drugs have extensive interactions with prescription drugs, affecting the therapeutic dose and disease mitigation.
targetString: Kekë wɛlkë kerou aanɔŋ liääpdït kekë wɛl cï ke göt, wɛ̈c kennë wɛl ë dëëk cï gät juëŋde pial ku cɛɛthë yic de tuany.

sourceString: Some people have allergic reactions to these drugs.On 12 April, a preliminary clinical trial conducted at a hospital in Brazil was stopped when several people given high doses of chloroquine for COVID-19 infection developed irregular heart rates, causing 11 deaths.
targetString: Kɔc kök aaye wɔ̈ɔ̈c keke wɛlkä. Ë Akɔ̈nydït e nïn 12, athëëm. akïm ë wɛtë ye nhom ë loi panakïm ë Bradhïl e cï cɔkë käc në kë cï kɔc juëc cï yiëk kolorkuin dït bïk dek në wɛ̈të wuɔɔk ë KOBIT-19 aacë piöth kɛn bënë ya kuen apɛi, ɛn nɛ̈k en raan 11.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show that favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Athëëmthëëm de akïm ë Cainïth tɔ̈ wuhan Cendhen e luel bë nyuɔth lɔn cï pabipirabir ë ye tɔ̈ kë "lui alajik".

sourceString: Of 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Në ayanïïn ke 35 cï ke them Shanzhen gokï cën kë tɔ̈ në ke guup në nïn cɛlic ke 4, kë bɛ̈rëic ë tuany e nïn 11 tënë ayanïïn ka 45 ëke kën e yöök.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: Në cärë cï loi Wuhan tënë ayanïïn ke 240 tënɔŋ tuany alirë piöuic , nhuth e cï yiën pabipirabir ku lööm nhuth në umipenobir.

sourceString: The term "preclinical research" is defined by laboratory studies in vitro and in vivo, indicating a beginning stage for development of a vaccine, antiviral or monoclonal antibody therapy, such as experiments to determine effective doses and toxicity, before a candidate compound is advanced for safety and efficacy evaluation in humans.
targetString: Wɛ̈t  "yɔ̈ɔ̈p tueŋdekïm" aye cäät në kuën de këcïp në bitro ku në bibo, ë nyoth ajöök kana de lɔtueŋë wäl ë guɔ̈p gëlic, wäl e bairäth nɔ̈k wälë monoklonal ë guɔ̈p titic apiɛth, cït yïk athëëm ë nyoth ë piath ë dëkë wɛl ku rɛ̈ɛ̈c de ke akutnhom wɛ̈ɛ̈r kënë guɔ lɛr tueŋ bë piath ku athëëm de latueŋ tënë kɔc.

sourceString: Some antibiotics may be repurposed as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Antibayotic kök alëu bï ke bɛ dhukë luɔndenic ë kee yïlacɛt ë KOBIT-19.

sourceString: In March 2020, the main protease of the SARS-CoV-2 virus was identified as a target for post-infection drugs.
targetString: Në 2020 Kol ic, muɔ̈k nhom de proteth ë bairäth ë SARS-CoV-2 e cï yöök ke yenne kë wïc tënë wuɔk-thɛɛr.

sourceString: This enzyme is essential to the host cell to reproduce the ribonucleic acid of the virus.
targetString: Yennë noŋ kënë arilic apɛi tënë rälthii ceŋ guɔ̈pic ago ribonukolic athit ë bairäth nyɔkë luɔi.

sourceString: To find the enzyme, scientists used the genome published by Chinese researchers in January 2020 to isolate the main protease.
targetString: Bɛ ë noŋë yöök, kɔc ye pïrë pial kany cök aake loi kën ë cï kɔc ë göör de Cainïthguär bec 2020 në kolic, ago ë muɔ̈k nhom de proteth wëŋ thok.

sourceString: As a potential combination therapy, they are used together in two Phase III arms of the 2020 global Solidarity project on COVID-19.
targetString: Kë ye amɛtnhom lëu bë gɛra de kë piɛth, aye kï loi atök në kök atëk III kerouic de 2020 ë ajuɛrde kɔ̈ɔ̈c atök ë pinynhom tënë KOBIT-19.

sourceString: A preliminary study in China of combined lopinavir and ritonavir found no effect in people hospitalized for COVID-19.
targetString: Në cärë akërnhiaamë Caina de amɛtëic ë lopinabir ku ritonabir acï yöök ë cën kë ye loi në kɔcë KOBIT-19 cï tääc.

sourceString: It is unclear yet whether conditions arising during pregnancy including diabetes, cardiac failure, hypercoagulability or hypertension might represent additional risk factors for pregnant people as they do for nonpregnant people.From the limited data available, vertical transmission during the third trimester probably does not occur, or only occurs very rarely.
targetString: Aŋuɔtë kuc apath lɔn ye ɣälɛt röt jat nhial dhamɛn ë liëc nɔŋ yïk thukari, köcë piöu, duötë riɛm wälë puɔrë riɛm aalëu bïk ya kök ë mɛ̈ckëla juak nhom tënë diär liɛc cë mën yenne luɔi tënë kɔc cïï liac. Tënë thönthii dakic tɔ̈, tëëk thïnë tuany në baŋ nhial në kaamë pɛ̈i kediäk kë tɛkdët ka ce rɔtë loi, wälë ace rɔt ë dac loi.

sourceString: There is no data yet on early pregnancy.
targetString: Acën käthii kor tɔ̈ në baŋ de dac liëcic.

sourceString: Little evidence exists to permit any solid conclusions about the nature of COVID-19 infection in pregnancy.
targetString: Këthin ë ye nyuɔth atɔ̈ ago gɛrë wɛ̈t akär la cök puöl në baŋde täde wuɔk ë KOBIT-19.

sourceString: A case series of 43 women from New York who tested positive for COVID-19 showed similar patterns to non-pregnant adults: 86% had mild disease, 9.3% had severe disease and 4.7% developed critical disease.
targetString: Në kä reke cök de tik 43 lɔŋde Niw Yɔk, cï ke yöök ëke nɔŋ tuany de KOBIT-19 e kä thöŋ mat rɔt tënë kɔc ŋuën cïï liɛc. 86% ake nɔŋ tuany piɔlic, 9.3% ake nɔŋ tuany rilic ku 4.7% acë tuany rilic apɛi rɔt loi tënë keek.

sourceString: Fetal distress was reported in two.
targetString: Agänygäny tënë mɛnh liɛc kɔc acï yöök në rouic.

sourceString: None of the women developed severe COVID-19 pneumonia or died.
targetString: Acën tiŋ töŋ e diärkä  cï KOBIT-19 alir pi öu nyin dït apɛi tënɔŋyen wälë thou.

sourceString: All of them had live birth pregnancies and no severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.
targetString: keke bën aake nɔŋ liëny dhiëth kek ë mïth kɛn pïr ku cën nëonatal athpidhia cï tïŋ kë rilic.

sourceString: The samples of breast milk, amniotic fluid, cord blood and neonatal throat swab were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative.In another study on 15 pregnant women, majority of the patients presented with fever and cough, while laboratory tests yielded lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.
targetString: Ŋuëkthii ë cakë thïn, pïu amniotik, riɛmë cör ku nëonatal alɛnh ë lɔɔk aröölic aake cï ke them në SARS-CoV-2, ku go nëtïja kedhiɛ bën bei kë rɛ̈ɛ̈ric ë pɛth. Në athëëm dët cï luɔi diär kök liɛc ke 15, kɔc juëc ke ayanïïn aacë bënë naŋ atuöc ku ɣɔl, ku go ɣönë thëëm athëëm lɔ nyuɔthë limpothitopenia tënë ayanïïn ke 12.

sourceString: Computed tomography findings of these patients were consistent with previous reports of non-pregnant patients, consisting of ground-glass opacities at early stage.
targetString: Yöök de ayanïïnkä cï cäät në cɔmpiöta aakë tɔ kë cën gɛra kenë guɛl tueŋ cë wɛn ë diär ayanïïn cë liɛc, ke nɔŋic gëlanth piny cenë daithïn në piac jöök.

sourceString: Follow-up images after delivery showed no progression of pneumonia.Media reports indicate that over 100 women with COVID-19 might have delivered, and in March 2020, no maternal deaths were reported.
targetString: Thurɛt de kuënyë cök në thökë dhiëth e ye nyuɔth ë cën lɔtueŋ de tuanyë piöu alir. Cɛɛl/guɛl ë kɔc e cɛɛlë käŋ ayë nyuɔth lɔn cï tik 100 kunhom nɔŋ KOBIT-19 dhiëth ku në Kol  2020, acën thon cï caal tënë dhiëth.

sourceString: Their guidelines thus advise that any pregnant person admitted to hospital with a COVID-19 infection should receive at least 10 days of prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin after being discharged from the hospital.
targetString: Kuɛrke tiët eke buɔthic e jëëmë lɔn bï gunë raan liac cï tääc panakïm cë wuɔk ë KOBIT-19 alëu bë lööm kä cït nïn ke 10 de propailatik nɔŋ athiɛkde-molekula-tɔ piiny të cïnë ye luöny bei panakïm.

sourceString: There are no data yet concerning the implications of COVID-19 infections for labour.
targetString: Acën käthii kor ë tɔ thiäk kenë wuɔk de KOBIT-19 rilic tënë röp.

sourceString: One infant girl born to a mother with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that she had been infected in utero and supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.
targetString: Mɛnh nya ë lual töŋë dhiëth man nɔŋ KOBIT-19 acë  kana de IgM jatnyin nhial në thaa kerouic ë dhiëth, ë luel lɔn ë cïnë ye ɣok na dhiëthic ku e ye thanycök en lɔn lëu bï wuök rɔt jɔk nhial ë lɔ piny në kökic.

sourceString: A small study involving 6 confirmed COVID-19 mothers showed no indication of SARS-COV-19 in their newborns' throats or serum but antibodies were present in neonatal blood sera samples, including IgM in two of the infants.
targetString: Akuën thin kor cë apiac dhiëth ke 6 cë yöök ëke nɔŋ KOBIT-19 e nyuɔth lɔn cën en SARS-COV-19 tënë röt ë mïthkɛnthii piɔc dhiëth wälë tuɔk lakin käkë guöp titic aake tɔ tënë ŋuëkthii riɛmë tuɔk ë nëonatal, nɔŋiyïk IgM tënë luët kerou.

sourceString: This is not usually passed from mother to fetus so further research is required to know whether the virus crossed the placenta or whether placentas of women in the study were damaged or abnormal.
targetString: Kënë akën kaŋ tëëk tënɔŋ tik lɔ töŋ meth kë yen yɔɔpdɛt awïc bï nyic lɔn ye bairäth tem lɔŋde lap wälë lɔn cï laap ë diär aa riöök në tïŋdeic wälë cïk tɔ tëden.

sourceString: Since COVID-19 shows similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, it is likely that their effect on pregnancy are similar.
targetString: Mënnë ye KOBIT-19 e nyuɔth en thöŋde kekë SARS-CoV ku MERS, alëu bë tɔ bë näk aa thöŋ tënë liëc.

sourceString: Four of seven had first trimester miscarriage, two of five had fetal growth restriction in the second trimester, and four of five had preterm birth.
targetString: Ŋuan në dhorouic aake nɔŋ rɛcë riim në pëi kediäk tueŋ, rou në dhïcic aake ril cilë mïth keke në pëi kediäk de rou, ku ŋuan në dhïcic aake cë thɔrbei.

sourceString: None of the newborns were infected with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Acën töŋ e luëtkä cë wuɔk në SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A report of ten cases of MERS- CoV infection in pregnancy in Saudi Arabia showed that the clinical presentation is variable, from mild to severe infection.
targetString: Guɛl ë käŋke thiär de wuɔkë MERS-CoV tënë liëc lɔŋë Thaudi Arabia e nyuɔth lɔn ye nyothë kïm e rëër kë wääc, në wuɔk kor nyin agut cë wuɔk rilic

sourceString: The outcome was favorable in a majority of the cases, but the infant death rate was 27%.A recent review suggested that COVID-19 appeared to be less lethal to mothers and infants than SARS and MERS but that there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks' gestation.
targetString: Nëtïja e bën bei thïn ee piɛth tënë kä juëc, lakin thonë lual e ye 27%.  Adhukë cɛthëic thiök piɔc loië e luel lɔn e KOBIT-19 rɔt nyuɔth kë ye nëk amääth tënë apiac dhiëth ku mïthë luët mënë SARS ku MERS lakin alëu bï naŋ juëkëic ë thörbei batë lätke 28 de liëc.

sourceString: The World Health Organization and  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention of the United States advises pregnant women to do the same things as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering cough, avoid interacting with sick people, cleaning hands with soap and water or sanitizer.
targetString: Akutnhom ë Pial Mɛt ë Pinynhom ku Ɣänke tïtë nyin ë Tuany ku Gël tɔ Amërika e diär liɛc jääm nhïïm agokï lui në kë loi juöör ëbën agokï cuɔk wuɔk, cït yïk kumë thok të ɣɔlïn, ba cuök liäp kekë kɔc tuany, wuëk ë cin në athabun ku pïu wälë thënitaidha.

sourceString: A survey conducted in Shanghai among pregnant women in different trimesters of pregnancy identified a strong demand for online access to health information and services.
targetString: Thärbei cï loi në lɔŋde Caŋai tënë diär liɛc në pɛ̈i ë liëc wääc ke diäk acë kuɛnybei lɔn wïcë ɣönlany apɛi ago thön ë pial ku käŋ ya yöök.

sourceString: People expecting their first baby were more willing to have online consultation and guidance than who had previously given birth.The RCOG and RCM recommend that in-person appointments be deferred by 7 days after the start of symptoms of COVID-19 or 14 days if another person in the household has symptoms.
targetString: Kɔc liac në mɛnhdɛn tuɛŋ aakek ëkë anhareic bïk aanaŋ thiëc ɣönlany ku nyuthëke mënë kɔc cë kaŋ dhiëth thɛr. Aye RCOG ku RCM thanpiny lɔn bï yöökë raan ya cuɔt në nïn ka 7 bat cï cïït ë KOBIT-19 jɔk wälë nïn 14 na nɔŋ raandɛt e panëic  nɔŋ cïït ëyɛ.

sourceString: Fever subsequently developed in three asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Atuöc acë bënë lɔtueŋ ëtëtöŋë në ayanïï lediäk nɔŋ cïït.

sourceString: One patient who had tested negative subsequently became symptomatic postpartum and tested positive three days after the initial negative test.
targetString: Ayaan töŋ ëcï them go cën kë yöök ye guöp acë bɛ bënë naŋ cïïtë tuany ɛcë dhiëth ku berë yöök kë tɔ ye guöp në thëëm themë ye batë nïn kediäk ke thëëm tueŋ.

sourceString: The doctors conducting the screening recommended that in order to reduce infection and allocate PPE, due to high numbers of patients presenting as asymptomatic, universal screening of pregnant patients should be conducted.
targetString: Dïktoor loi thiëthëic aye kï luel acän ba wuɔk dhuök piny ku wëŋ PPE thok, në wëtë adɛndït tɔ nhial ayanïïn wɛn nyoth cïtë tuany, kë amatnhomde thiëthëic de ayanïïn liɛc bï loi.

sourceString: They also suggest that people with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 should have continuous electronic fetal monitoring.
targetString: Aye kï thɔŋic ë luɛl lɔn bïnë kɔc dɛk kɔc ke piöth wälë cï det ëke nɔŋ KOBIT-19 bïk lɔtueŋ ë mïth liɛcë tït kɔc le nyiin në makana kärba.

sourceString: The use of birthing pools is not recommended for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 due to the risk of infection via faeces.
targetString: luɔide pulë laak akëcë thanpiny tënë kɔc dɛkë piɔth wälë kɔc cï det ëke tuany në KOBIT-19 në wët bïnë wuɔk në ceth.

sourceString: In the UK, official recommendations state that precautionary separation of a mother and a healthy baby should not be undertaken lightly and that they should be kept together in the postpartum period where neonatal care is not required.Literature from China recommended separation of infected mothers from babies for 14 days.
targetString: Thɛnpinydït nyic tɔ UK, aye luel lɔn cë lëu bïnë tïtë nyin tueŋ bïnë mɛnh piɔl guöp atekic kekë man lööm kë piɔlic ku lɔn bïnë ke täu atök në kaam piac dhiëth yenë nëonatal cuökë wïc. Warɛŋë kä cï ke gɔt tɔ Caina aye luel tëkë yic dë amëdhiëëth tënɔŋ mïthkɛn në nïnic ka 14

sourceString: In the US there is also the recommendation that newborns and mothers should be temporarily separated until transmission-based precautions are discontinued, and that where this is not possible the newborn should be kept 2 metres away from the mother.
targetString: Anɔŋ thɛnpinydɛt tɔ US yennë mïthë lual ku märkɛn tekic në kamkoric agut cë tïtë nyin tueŋ ë käke wuɔk temkɔ̈th, ku na e të cë lëuen rɔt thïn kë mɛnhë lual alëu bï täu në mëtïr ke 2 ëmec kekë man.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.
targetString: Böök ë b'KOBIT-19 anɔŋic tïtë nyin ë lɔ becë tuanyë koronabairäth agorë thurë cäthë lɔtueŋë tuany cɔ̈k piny.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, with focus of case finding, testing and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.
targetString: Akutnhom ë Pial Mɛ̈të Pinynhom(APMP) acë böök lui apiɛth thanpiny, kekë rokë nhomthïn në yöökë këdɛ̈, thëmthëm, ku jɔla kuëny cökë käkë yup tënë ɣänë lɔbec ë tuany.

sourceString: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
targetString: Böök de KOBIT-19 aye ŋɔ̈th bë nyin tït në kä bë bɛ̈n nhial tënë epidɛmiologikol, ku ye kä jöt dac nyic, në kɛnde e thön kënë kɔ̈u, gɛm thönde epidëmiologikal ago mɛ̈ckëla caaric ku böök ajuɛrë tuany.

sourceString: Syndromic surveillance is done based on the symptoms of an individual that corresponds to COVID-19.
targetString: Böökë cïïtë nyin tuany aye loi ë kɛnë cïïtë tuany kɔ̈th raan cë guöp pial në KOBIT-19

sourceString: As of March 2020, the WHO recommends the following case definitions:
targetString: Në Kol ic 2020, kë APMP ecë cɛ̈ɛ̈të kä tɔ̈ cɛ̈ɛ̈nkä thanpiny:

sourceString: Probable case : "A suspect case for whom testing for the COVID-19 virus is inconclusive" OR "a suspect case for whom testing could not be performed for any reason".
targetString: Lëu bë rɔt lëu: "Kë wɛ̈n dekë piɔ̈th na them në KOBIT-19 bairäth, ka cë lëu bë thökde nyuɔth" WÄLË "kë wɛ̈n dekë piɔ̈th na them ka cë lëu bë rɔt loi në wɛ̈të kök".

sourceString: Confirmed case: "A person with laboratory confirmation of COVID-19 infection, irrespective of clinical signs and symptoms".
targetString: Kë cï deet: Raan tɔ̈ ë cë wuɔk në KOBIT-19 cï dët tënë këcïp, acɔkë cën yen kë ye nyuɔth ku cïït ë tuany.

sourceString: Direct physical contact with a probable or confirmed case;
targetString: Gɔ̈të guöp ë raan lëu bë naŋ tuany wälë raan cïï deet kë tuany:

sourceString: Direct care for a patient with probable or confirmed COVID-19 disease without using proper personal protective equipment;
targetString: Tït ë nyin ayan lëu bë tuany wälë cïï deet ke tɔ̈ ke tuany ë KOBIT-19 kë cën kä piɛth ye raan ke rɔt tit.

sourceString: Other situations as indicated by local risk assessments".WHO recommends reporting of probable and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.
targetString: Ɣälɛt kök cë mɛn cïnë ye nyuɔth në kɔcthii bai e macakil caathic, "aye APMP thanpiny yennë guelë kä lëu bïk naŋ tuany ku kä cï ke deet ëke cë wuɔk në KOBIT-19 në thaa ke 48 ic ke nyïny cïnë ye nyic."

sourceString: The countries should report on a case-by-case basis as far as possible, but in case of limitation in resources, aggregate weekly reporting is also possible.
targetString: Bɛ̈i apiɛth bïkï ya guɛl në kä loi rɔt në tök-ku-tök të lëu yen rɔt, lakin na nɔŋ të dak lɔŋde käŋ, kë mɛ̈të ic ë läät bï ke jäl caalë tök alëu rɔt.

sourceString: Some organizations have created crowdsourced apps for syndromic surveillance, where people can report their symptoms to help researchers map areas with concentration of COVID-19 symptoms.
targetString: Akutnhïïm kök acë lui në kë ye cïïtë tuany böök tënë dunë kɔc, kë bï kɔc cïïtkɛnë tuany ya luɛl bec thïn ago kɔc yɔ̈ɔ̈p kuɔny klbïk ɣän nɔŋ cïïtë tuany ë KOBIT -19 juëc ya yöök.

sourceString: Virological surveillance is done by using molecular tests for COVID-19.
targetString: Tïtë nyin ë bairäth aye loi në thëëm ë molekular de KOBIT-19.

sourceString: WHO has published resources for laboratories on how to perform testing for COVID-19.
targetString: APMP acë käŋ ɣönë këcïp në të cït të bïnë thëëm de KOBIT-19 ya luɔi thïn.

sourceString: In the European Union, laboratory confirmed cases of COVID-19 are reported within 24 hours of identification.
targetString: Tëde Amɛtnhomde Yuropïn, käke tuany de KOBIT-19 cï ke deet ɣönë këcïp aaye ke caal në thääiyic ka 24 ke nyïny cïnë ye nyic.

sourceString: At least 24 countries have established digital surveillance of their citizens.
targetString: Të cït tënë bɛ̈i ka 24 aakek  aacë tïtë nyin në cɔmpiöta cɔ̈k pinytënë mïthkɛnë bai.

sourceString: The digital surveillance technologies include apps, location data and electronic tags.
targetString: Tïtë nyin tɛ̈knɔlojide cɔmpiöta anɔŋic kë yennë lui thïn, thönthii ke tëde rëër ku kä cï ke täu në karba.

sourceString: The Center For Disease Control and Prevention in USA tracks the travel information of individuals using airline passenger data.
targetString: Tëde gëlë riääk ku tïtë nyin tɔ̈ USA, e thönë kɔc caath muök nyin në thönthii ke kɔc caath në riän nhial.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, authorities are requiring a bracelet and an app for all travellers.
targetString: Kɔc akuma de Ɣɔŋ Kɔŋ, awïcë kabeca ku jɔla kë ye käŋ nyuɔth tënë kɔc caath kedhiɛ.

sourceString: A GPS app is used to track the locations of individuals in South Korea to ensure against quarantine breach, sending alerts to the user and to authorities if people leave designated areas.
targetString: GPS e käŋ nyuɔth aaye loi bïnë ɣän ke rëër ë raan aa muök nyin lɔŋde Thauth Koria ago cën dhuŋë löŋde tëuë rɔt tɛ̈n tök kɔ̈u, bë loi ye  lɛ̈k ku jɔla kɔc akuma të jɛ̈l kɔc  në ɣän cïnë ke täu thïnic.

sourceString: In Singapore, individuals have to report their locations with photographic proof.
targetString: Lɔŋde Thiŋapor, kɔc aaye ɣänkɛn tɔ̈ keke thïn luël kekë thura e ye cäät.

sourceString: Thailand is using an app and SIM cards for all travelers to enforce their quarantine.
targetString: Thailan aloi ke ye käŋ nyuɔth ku SIM tëne kɔc caath kedhiɛ agokï ë cɔke tɔ̈ në ɣänkɛn ë rëër.
